Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; traces of two pairs of faded white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of bull’s head, to right and part of hound standing on hind legs (head, front legs and lower part of hind legs lost), to right; curled swastikas, dots and crosses as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Hounds are very rarely depicted on vases of the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 255, no. 445, pl. 445)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0520) (phase 2)
